heuristicsmineR 0.2.0

Precendence Matrix

Source: R/precedence_matrix_absolute.R
precedence_matrix_absolute.Rd

Construct a precendence matrix, showing how activities are followed by each other. This function computes the precedence matrix directly in C++ for efficiency. Only the type absolute of (precedence_matrix) is supported.

precedence_matrix_absolute(eventlog, lead = 1)

Arguments

eventlog

The event log object to be used.
lead

The distance between activities following/preceding each other.

Examples

library(eventdataR)
data(traffic_fines)
m <- precedence_matrix_absolute(traffic_fines)
print(m)
#> # A tibble: 47 x 3
#>    antecedent                          consequent                              n
#>    <fct>                               <fct>                               <int>
#>  1 Receive Result Appeal from Prefect~ Notify Result Appeal to Offender       51
#>  2 Send for Credit Collection          End                                  3384
#>  3 Add penalty                         Receive Result Appeal from Prefect~    15
#>  4 Send Fine                           End                                  1893
#>  5 Add penalty                         Send Appeal to Prefecture             171
#>  6 Insert Fine Notification            Insert Date Appeal to Prefecture      188
#>  7 Insert Date Appeal to Prefecture    Add penalty                           170
#>  8 Send Fine                           Insert Fine Notification             4633
#>  9 Create Fine                         Send Fine                            6557
#> 10 Appeal to Judge                     Insert Date Appeal to Prefecture        1
#> # ... with 37 more rows
as.matrix(m)
